title: 52 Best Spring Salad Recipes - Seasonal Spring Salad Ideas
description: We're going to spring forward... right into these salads.
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe Headquarters52 Easy Spring Salads That Are Truly The Reason For The Season52 Easy Spring Salads That Are Truly The Reason For The SeasonWe're going to spring forward... right into these salads.By Camille Lowder and Mo GoldsteinUpdated: Apr 9, 2025Save ArticlePHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONBe honest here: Is there anything better than spring produce? We think not. Now that we're shaking off that winter chill, we're so ready to spring forward... right into these salads. 'Tis the season when fruits and vegetables start being at their peak, so definitely take advantage with these recipes for spring-y salads like our strawberry spinach salad, spring Cobb salad, and tzatziki potato salad. These 52 fresh and exciting salad recipes also work well as side dishes or the main event too. There will always be room at our table for the uncomplicated classics, particularly when we’re serving a more involved main dish. Arugula, spinach, and kale salads with bright and easy vinaigrettes can be so lovely in their simplicity. That said, our hearts really belong to the FULL salads, the kind that can stand alone as a meal and has tons of texture and flavor. Here, we’re filling or topping our salads with everything from fried halloumi to sweet spring strawberries on a spinach salad. Feel free to get creative and add your favorites too; we're pretty partial to our roasted cauliflower salad and our beyond gorgeous super-green pasta salad. Also, we’d be remiss if we only focused on the greens here. Macaroni salad is always a summer crowd-pleaser, but for spring, we like to go outside the box and try out different "pasta" shapes, like the orrechiette in our bruschetta pasta salad, the ramen in our crunchy Mandarin orange chicken salad, and the papaya in our green papaya salad.  And they’re not all mayo-based! We think spring is a great time to focus on bright, vibrant flavors, so we’ve relied on vinegars and citrus to add some brightness to our salads. We’ve also got a couple warm options for those cold spring nights when the temperature unexpectedly drops, like our lentil salad or Tuscan tortellini salad. The best part? They make for great cold leftovers the next day too.Speaking of chilly evenings, nothing pairs better with salad than soup, so make sure to check out our favorite springy soups to complete your meal. 1Strawberry Spinach SaladPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSThe combination of sweet strawberries, herby chicken, creamy goat cheese, and spicy red onions may even make so-called spinach haters love this recipe.Get the Strawberry Spinach Salad recipe.2Spring Cobb SaladPHOTO: LUCY SCHAEFFER PHOTOGRAPHY; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThis lightened-up Cobb salad has lots of crunchy in-season veggies and a creamy lemon-dill dressing spiked with raw garlic. A smattering of croutons (homemade is best if you’ve got the time) add texture, and a healthy serving of eggs and avocado make this salad hearty enough to be dinner.Get the Spring Cobb Salad recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Lemon, Ricotta & Asparagus Pasta SaladPHOTO: BRYAN GARDNER; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORElready beloved in hot pasta dishes like our lemon-ricotta pasta, ricotta is a natural for pasta salads too. Mixed with fresh lemon juice and zest, plenty of grated Parmesan, and pasta water, the ricotta melts into a creamy, bright sauce without any additional oil. Get the Lemon, Ricotta & Asparagus Pasta Salad recipe. 4Spring Chicken Panzanella SaladPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONSpring calls for vibrant, bountiful bowls of greens. Enter this panzanella salad. Asparagus, snap peas, tender greens, and roasted chicken are tossed with crispy croutons in a light vinaigrette for a salad that’s light but infinitely satisfying. Get the Spring Chicken Panzanella Salad recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Greek SaladPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING BARRETT WASHBURNEWhen you’re looking for simple, refreshing, and reliable, you’d be hard pressed to find a dish better than classic Greek salad. Filled with fresh veggies, tangy feta, and a simple dressing made of ingredients you might already have in your fridge, this bright salad is one you’ll turn to all spring and summer longGet the Greek Salad recipe.6TikTok Green Goddess SaladPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREWe loved the original recipe for this viral salad, but we wanted to add a bit of a Greek/Mediterranean flavor profile. The original recipe calls for two types of nuts, but ours calls for tahini. We also sub dill for basil and garnish with some toasted sesame seeds.Get the TikTok Green Goddess Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Bruschetta Pasta SaladPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONTo create an easy side dish worthy of any potluck, we returned to the flavors of tried-and-tried bruschetta. The result? This bruschetta pasta salad, loaded with multi-colored cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and tangy balsamic vinegar.Get the Bruschetta Pasta Salad recipe.8Spinach SaladPHOTO: JULIA GARTLAND; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEThis simple spinach salad is the perfect accompaniment to pretty much anything. We're all about sharp mustard vinaigrette paired with creamy feta and toasted almonds, but you can swap in your favorite cheese and nuts if you like!Get the Spinach Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Greek Orzo SaladPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: SIMON ANDREWSWhile we love orzo in comforting, warming pasta dishes (we're looking at you, orzo al limone) it also makes for a great salad base. Take this Greek-inspired recipe to the park for a light picnic lunch, or as fresh side to your Easter potluck. No matter the occasion, this salad was made to please.Get the Greek Orzo Salad recipe.10Egg SaladPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONIt’s always a good idea to have a tried-and-true egg salad recipe up your sleeve: it’s easy to make, and is a classic BBQ side and quick lunch you can rely on. Our standard centers around just 6 core ingredients; use it as a base for creative mix-ins and variations, or enjoy as is for a truly classic recipe. Whether you’re craving egg salad sandwiches for a warm weather picnic or are looking for a staple summer side, make this best egg salad recipe your new go-to.Get the Egg Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Moroccan Carrot SaladPARKER FEIERBACHThis carrot-and-raisin salad gets an upgrade with a slightly spicy, slightly sweet harissa and honey sauce. It brings out the sweet freshness of the carrots and makes the whole dish sing. You might be tempted to pour it over all of your salads from here on out.Get the Moroccan Carrot Salad recipe.12Greek Salmon SaladAndrew BuiWhenever we're craving a salad, it usually means we want something fresh and crisp with lots of flavor. And a salad that won't leave us hungry in 30 minutes. While the salmon is cooking, you can get all of your veggie chopping done. An easy dinner with big reward!Get the Greek Salmon Salad recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Broccoli SaladPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREA simple and reliable side, the classic broccoli salad is loaded with flavor and texture. Ready in around 30 minutes, it’s the perfect make-ahead side for an BBQ or last-minute party. Get the Broccoli Salad recipe.14Super Green Pasta SaladErik BernsteinIt’s not so hard to eat your greens when they come in pasta salad form. Sweet baby spinach is great here, but peppery arugula or tender baby kale would work well too.Get the Super Green Pasta Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Greek Chickpea SaladPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEWe’re no strangers to a great chickpea salad, so coming up with a Greek-inspired one was a no-brainer. It’s got all the flavors you love from Greek salad, turned into something more substantial and filling that pairs well with almost anything.Get the Greek Chickpea Salad recipe. 16Halloumi SaladAndrew BuiWe think it's due time that halloumi, got its time in the spotlight. Besides the delightfully squeaky texture (where the cheese curd lovers at?) and the tangy, salty flavor, the high melting point is really what makes this cheese stand out—when heat is applied, it develops a delicious golden crust that is so delightful in this salad.Get the Halloumi Salad recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Cobb SaladPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREIn our book, the Cobb salad just might be the perfect dinner salad. It’s versatile, hearty, easy to make, and even easier to meal prep. Our classic recipe creates the perfect balance of textures and flavors, all tied together by the star of the show: our homemade dressing. Get the Cobb Salad recipe.18Tuscan Tortellini SaladPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORESwap the sun-dried tomatoes for fresh cherry tomatoes, use kale instead of spinach or bacon instead of salami, and replace the Parmesan with Pecorino or mozzarella. It's easily customizable!Get the Tuscan Tortellini Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Fried Goat Cheese SaladPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREA quick pan-fry makes creamy goat cheese a fun, super-crunchy salad topper. It’s a creative take on croutons and makes a simple salad so much more exciting. These are also great on their own and would be delicious on a cheese board with a little drizzle of honey. Get the Fried Goat Cheese Salad recipe. 20Avocado-Mango Poke SaladLindsay Maitland hunt Since this salad is so simple, use the best, freshest tuna, mangoes, and avocados you can find!Get the Avocado-Mango Poke Salad recipe.Watch Next Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowSpring RecipesHow To Pack The Perfect PicnicLemon-Blueberry Brie Bites82 Simple Spring DinnersLemon Asparagus PastaAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below15 Editor-Picked Spring Cocktails69 Springy Easter AppetizersSpiral Ham85 Best Easter Side Dishes79 Best Easter Dinner Ideas65 Best Easter Lunch IdeasGreen Goddess GnocchiBrie, Asparagus & Prosciutto-Stuffed ChickenAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc. right into these salads.\u003c/p\u003e","display_instagram_embeds":1,"social_dek":"\u003cp\u003eWe're going to spring forward... right into these salads. \u003c/p\u003e","short_title":"52 Easy Spring Salad Recipes","index_title":"52 Easy Spring Salads That Are Truly The Reason For The Season ","introductory_text":"\u003cp\u003eBe honest here: Is there anything better than \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/best-spring-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003espring\u003c/a\u003e produce? We think not. Now that we're shaking off that winter chill, we're so ready to \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/best-spring-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003espring\u003c/a\u003e forward... right into these \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/g30717155/spring-salads/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esalads\u003c/a\u003e. 'Tis the season when fruits and vegetables start being at their peak, so definitely take advantage with these recipes for spring-y salads like our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a27077746/easy-strawberry-spinach-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estrawberry spinach salad\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a39831300/spring-cobb-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003espring Cobb salad\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a39630682/tzatziki-potato-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003etzatziki potato salad\u003c/a\u003e. These 52 fresh and exciting salad recipes also work well as side dishes or the \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/nutrition/g2599/healthy-dinner-salads/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003emain event\u003c/a\u003e too. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere will always be room at our table for the uncomplicated classics, particularly when we’re serving a more involved main dish. \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a20153927/arugula-salad-recipe/\"\u003eArugula\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a19695920/simple-spinach-salad-recipe/\"\u003espinach\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a39077395/lolita-kale-salad-recipe/\"\u003ekale\u003c/a\u003e salads with bright and easy vinaigrettes can be \u003cem\u003eso\u003c/em\u003e lovely in their simplicity. That said, our hearts really belong to the FULL salads, the kind that can stand alone as a meal and has tons of texture and flavor. Here, we’re filling or topping our salads with everything from \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a36321546/halloumi-salad-recipe/\"\u003efried halloumi\u003c/a\u003e to sweet spring \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a27077746/easy-strawberry-spinach-salad-recipe/\"\u003estrawberries on a spinach salad\u003c/a\u003e. Feel free to get creative and add your favorites too; we're pretty partial to our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a41300962/roasted-cauliflower-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eroasted cauliflower salad\u003c/a\u003e and our beyond gorgeous \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/a36816436/vegan-pasta-salad/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esuper-green pasta salad\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAlso, we’d be remiss if we only focused on the greens here. \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a53236/classic-macaroni-salad-recipe/\"\u003eMacaroni salad\u003c/a\u003e is always a summer crowd-pleaser, but for spring, we like to go outside the box and try out different \"pasta\" shapes, like the orrechiette in our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a47335/bruschetta-pasta-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ebruschetta pasta salad\u003c/a\u003e, the ramen in our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a53792/chinese-chicken-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecrunchy Mandarin orange chicken salad\u003c/a\u003e, and the papaya in our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a39629712/green-papaya-salad-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egreen papaya salad\u003c/a\u003e.  And they’re not all mayo-based! We think spring is a great time to focus on bright, vibrant flavors, so we’ve relied on vinegars and citrus to add some brightness to our salads. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWe’ve also got a couple warm options for those cold spring nights when the temperature unexpectedly drops, like our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a32292934/lentil-salad-recipe/\"\u003elentil salad\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a47091/tuscan-tortellini-salad-recipe/\"\u003eTuscan tortellini salad\u003c/a\u003e. there anything better than spring produce? We think not. Now that we're shaking off that winter chill, we're so ready to spring forward... right into these salads. 'Tis the season when fruits and vegetables start being at their peak, so definitely take advantage with these recipes for spring-y salads like our strawberry spinach salad, spring Cobb salad, and tzatziki potato salad. These 52 fresh and exciting salad recipes also work well as side dishes or the main event too. There will always be room at our table for the uncomplicated classics, particularly when we’re serving a more involved main dish. Arugula, spinach, and kale salads with bright and easy vinaigrettes can be so lovely in their simplicity. That said, our hearts really belong to the FULL salads, the kind that can stand alone as a meal and has tons of texture and flavor. Here, we’re filling or topping our salads with everything from fried halloumi to sweet spring strawberries on a spinach salad. Feel free to get creative and add your favorites too; we're pretty partial to our roasted cauliflower salad and our beyond gorgeous super-green pasta salad. Also, we’d be remiss if we only focused on the greens here. Macaroni salad is always a summer crowd-pleaser, but for spring, we like to go outside the box and try out different \"pasta\" shapes, like the orrechiette in our bruschetta pasta salad, the ramen in our crunchy Mandarin orange chicken salad, and the papaya in our green papaya salad.  And they’re not all mayo-based! We think spring is a great time to focus on bright, vibrant flavors, so we’ve relied on vinegars and citrus to add some brightness to our salads. We’ve also got a couple warm options for those cold spring nights when the temperature unexpectedly drops, like our lentil salad or Tuscan tortellini salad. The best part? They make for great cold leftovers the next day too.Speaking of chilly evenings, nothing pairs better with salad than soup, so make sure to check out our favorite springy soups to complete your meal.
